title: Is the metric system better? - Quora

response.answer_text: The word “better” is a subjective term. Those others answering this question to say they think the non-metric units are better base that on three things, usually: They are more familiar with the non-metric units. Well, if they used the metric units for a while those units would become familiar also. So this is a bit of circular logic: I don’t use it because it’s not familiar and it’s not familiar because I don’t use it.Many great things have been accomplished using non-metric units. True! But many great things have been accomplished using metric units as well. It should not escape notice that 95 % of the people in the world use only the metric system in their everyday lives and surely they accomplish great things, too.Non-metric units get compared to body parts and so they seem “more natural”. Well an inch is roughly the length of the first bone in your thumb or finger and a centimeter is roughly the width of that digital segment. A foot relates (very roughly!) to the length of your foot (check it for yourselves, ladies!) and a decimeter is roughly the width of your palm. “A (U.S.) pint’s a pound” and “a kilogram’s a liter”—both good rules of thumb for water. One could go on and on about this.So, why do I think the metric system is better? I have undertaken the effort to use it and so it has now become familiar. I would rather scale things by multiplying by 10, 100, or 1000 (just move the decimal point) than by 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 32, 5.5, 16.5, 1760, and 5280—especially recalling when to use which of those weird factors! And, lastly, it makes it easier to communicate with the 95 % of the world that uses only the metric system. If I were in business to produce or sell things, that would be an even better reason! So, to me, those who tell us why they don’t use the metric system are just saying that their real reason is “I don’t want to.”

The US sent people to the moon and back, it dominates on space programs, it built an entire industrial and high tech complex, unrivaled in the world. All of these were based on the imperial system. I don’t think anyone can say metric is better. It’s just a different system for measurement, no better, no worse.
